Legal_Issue: Was the visa officer's decision to reject the applicant's permanent residency application based on work experience and financial credibility reasonable?
Application_Facts: Applicant was denied points for work experience due to incorrect NOC assessment; lacked credible financial documentation.
Decision_Outcome: Visa officer erred in applying NOC categories and breached procedural fairness.
Court_Ruling: Judicial review granted; case remanded for reassessment.
Defendant_Behavior: Failed to evaluate chosen NOC category (4162); did not provide opportunity to address document reliability.
Grounds_for_Claim: Insufficient work experience points, unreliable financial documents, incorrect NOC assessment, procedural unfairness.
Assessment_Factor: Work experience under correct NOC category, credibility of financial documents.
Applicable_Legislation: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide procedural fairness; no opportunity to respond to concerns about document credibility.
Credibility_Assessment: Financial documentation deemed not credible; no chance given to clarify.
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessed: Work experience duration and role alignment with NOC 4162, source and consistency of financial documents.
Relief_Sought: Judicial review and re-determination by a different officer
Governing_Rule: Under subsection 72(1), judicial review applies patent unreasonableness standard to visa officer decisions; procedural fairness required.
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of credible financial documentation; misclassification of NOC category.
Outcome: Case referred for re-determination by a different visa officer.
Decisional_Body: Visa officer, reviewed by Federal Court
Harm_Assessment: Unfair rejection of application due to errors in assessment and lack of procedural fairness.
Cause_Description: Rejection based on insufficient work experience points and unreliable financial documents.
Evidence_Handling: Officer did not allow applicant to address reliability concerns regarding submitted documents.
Legal_Provision_Violated: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Issues: Questionable credibility of financial documents; incorrect NOC classification affecting work experience evaluation.
Legal_Provision: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Work experience not assessed under correct NOC; financial evidence dismissed without verification opportunity.
Decision_Rationale: Officer failed to assess application under chosen NOC 4162 and violated procedural fairness by not allowing response to document concerns.
Decision_Making_Body: Visa Officer, subject to judicial review by Federal Court
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of opportunity to clarify financial documentation; incorrect NOC used in assessment.
